Name: Painted fresco
Description: A fragment of fresco painting showing the figure of a seated man with his hands raised, catching water, probably from the sycamore goddess. The man wears a kilt of linen, the detail of which is picked out in red. Across his chest is a band of pleated linen and he wears an ornamental collar. The relief probably dates to between the 19th Dynasty and the 20th Dynasty.
